Jim and all,

It is interesting to see the geographic connections, especial=
ly since the Japanese "invented" all of these techniques and motifs, right?=
 (Reminds me of the Greeks, the Italians, etc.) See part of "Lies My Teache=
rs Taught Me" by Bob Haynes in the most recent To-Ron for further comments =
along these lines.

I just saw an Indian dagger in the Asian Art Museum in =
San Francisco that had gold inlay on the blade done this way no doubt, actu=
ally in the kind of tendril designs we see so often on Japanese metalwork. =
It had a walrus ivory handle, a very attractive item. Unfortunately my note=
s on it's date and place are temporarily inaccessible, and my digital camer=
a batteries died just after I got to the museum.

Craig Harris

Sep 2003 17:51:51 -0400, Jim Gilbert wrote:
